etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French dissenterie, or via Latin from Greek dusenteria, from dusenteros ‘afflicted in the bowels’, from dus- ‘bad’ + entera ‘bowels’

definitions: infection of the intestines resulting in severe diarrhea with the presence of blood and mucus in the feces.

notes.text: bacterial dysentery is caused by bacteria of the genus Shigella and can also spread by contact (see amoebic dysentery, shigella)

shortDefinitions: infection of intestines resulting in severe diarrhoea
